This museum shows what dedicated staff are able to do. It is most interesting and has many suitably displayed artifacts relating to the old trails that once led people to the west... read more
Cute little movie theater for a small town it has a nice cozy feel to it. The staff are always friendly and very quick.
The theater is small, but it's comfy and the prices aren't bad! I always get the kids' tray which is perfect for me. . . $5 for popcorn, small candy and a small drink.
Excellent walking trails on edge of town. Not crowded. Can choose flat or trails that go to an overview.
Susanville Ranch Park features many trails for hiking, biking and horseback riding. One of my favorites is the Old Paul Bunyan Road trail that takes you up 2+ miles, cross Paiute... read more
Discovered this gem while traveling to Las Vegas. Stayed an extra day to explore the trails and now back to ride for four days. Love the super D and the South Side. Extremely... read more
Wonderful old railroad grade = almost flat, multi-user friendly. Follows the Susan River up hill from town. October = fall colors. Saw a couple of deer, and not many people... read more
Bike riding or hiking on this trail along the beautiful Susan River is one of my great escapes. Dogs love it, too!
Beautiful trail great scenery have been there in the summer/ spring and just again last week there was still lots of snow and parts if the river were frozen over, have even seen... read more

Fine wide trail made from old railroad line. Tunnels and old railroad bridges make this a fun run or bike.

Diamond Mountain Brewery.knownFor: “ Disgusting beer ” Reviewed May 11, 2016 via mobile I went to the casino restaurant during the breweries opening week early this year and ordered their IPA. It was the darkest IPA I've ever seen and sooo bitter. One drink of it was all I needed to send it back with the waiter. The waiter said the guy brewing was new at it. If you like trying out new...
